content: The limit for storage space and the number of rooms is about to be exceeded

comment.text: The translation key "StorageAndRoomHeader" is used to display a warning message when the storage space and room limits are about to be exceeded. This message appears in a quotas bar component, specifically at the header section, providing context for users of the "QuotasBarTypes.RoomsAndStorageTariffLimit" case.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'about to be exceeded' implies an imminent threshold. The Arabic translation 'تم تجاوز' (tam tajawuz) means 'has been exceeded'. This doesn't convey the sense of imminence.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a translation that reflects the 'about to be exceeded' nuance, such as 'سيتم تجاوز' (sayatam tajawuz) which means 'will be exceeded' or 'على وشك التجاوز' (ala washk at-tajawuz) which means 'on the verge of exceeding'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation '스토리지 공간 및 룸 수가 한도를 초과하려고 합니다' is a literal translation and sounds unnatural in Korean. While technically correct, it lacks fluency. The phrasing 'about to be exceeded' is not naturally expressed this way.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 스토리지 공간 및 룸 수 제한이 곧 초과됩니다

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation 'ຂີດຈຳກັດສຳລັບເນື້ອທີ່ເກັບຮັກສາ ແລະ ຈຳນວນຫ້ອງກຳລັງຈະເກີນຂີດຈຳກັດໄວ້ແລ້ວ' is a bit literal and doesn't flow naturally in Lao. It translates to 'The limit for storage space and the number of rooms is about to exceed the limit already'. It's a bit verbose.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more concise and natural phrasing such as: 'ເນື້ອທີ່ເກັບຮັກສາ ແລະ ຈຳນວນຫ້ອງເກີນຂີດຈຳກັດໄວ້ແລ້ວ' (Storage space and number of rooms have already exceeded the limit) or 'ກຳລັງເກີນຂີດຈຳກັດໄວ້ແລ້ວ' (About to exceed the limit).  The best phrasing will depend on the exact context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Limita maximă permisă de stocare și de săli este pe punctul de a fi depăşit" is a bit literal and awkward. 'Sali' (rooms) is plural and doesn't quite fit the flow. It’s more natural to use a phrasing that reflects the general concept of exceeding a limit.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Limita de stocare și numărul de camere este pe punctul de a fi depășit.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'depășit' is spelled correctly, but it might be helpful to use a more accessible synonym to improve clarity for users.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'atins' (reached) or 'depășită' (exceeded) depending on the context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'ධාරිතාව සහ කාමර සංඛ්‍යාව ඉක්මවීමට නියමිතය.' is a literal translation but doesn't fully capture the nuance of 'about to be exceeded'. It implies a certainty that might not be intended. A more natural phrasing would convey a warning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ධාරිතාව සහ කාමර සංඛ්‍යාව ඉක්ම යාමට අවකාශයක් තිබේ.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'ධාරිතාව' might be perceived as slightly formal. A more common and accessible word might improve clarity.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: කාමර සංඛ්‍යාව හා ගබඩා කරන ප්‍රමාණය ඉක්ම යාමට අවකාශයක් තිබේ.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation "Лимит за складишни простор и број просторија ће ускоро бити прекорачен" translates literally as 'The limit for storage space and number of rooms will soon be exceeded.' While understandable, a more natural and user-friendly phrasing would be 'Скоро ће бити прекоречен лимит за складишни простор и број просторија.' or 'Прекорачен је лимит за складишни простор и број просторија'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Прекорачен је лимит за складишни простор и број просторија
